content:
Case Study: LLMs in Indian Banking

HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, and SBI are among India's leading financial institutions exploring AI-powered customer service. With millions of customers and limited branch capacity, these banks need to handle high query volumes efficiently.

The AI Solution

Large Language Models (LLMs) based on transformer architectures power conversational AI systems that can answer customer queries in English, Hindi, and regional languages. The models are fine-tuned on banking-specific data.

Results

HDFC's AI system handles millions of customer interactions monthly, reducing call centre volume and improving first-response resolution rates. Fraud detection models analyse transaction patterns in real-time to flag anomalies.

Key Learning

LLMs require significant fine-tuning and safety guardrails for financial applications. Data privacy (RBI guidelines) adds regulatory constraints that shape model design.
